intro: Diastema scabrum, commonly known as the rough diastema, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
